text: @jewlicious @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig my starting point is that to know someone is to know their family history. you apparently don't know his, so my conclusion is either a) he does not exist, or b) you don't actually know him that well.
@metrobuster @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig It's offensive that your starting point is that I am lying. So thanks for your input. Have a nice day.
@jewlicious @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig whether you are lying to me that he exists, or just lying that you know him well, idrc, that's between you and your dignity

@metrobuster @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig Dude. I told you where his hummus joint is. I told you his name. Go ask him. What do you want me to do? Send you video of me ordering hummus while wearing a GoPro?
@jewlicious @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig only one person in this convo is pretending like we know a guy, and it ain't me.
@metrobuster @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig And you do when you don't know him, or me, at all. Good one bro. You got me. Waaaah.
@jewlicious @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig for a real guy you reportedly know well, "seems like" you don't know shit about what he really thinks lmao

@metrobuster @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig Ask him. His hummus joint is on the Villa Dolorosa between the 5th and 6th station of the cross. We seem to get along just fine and I was at his son's graduation from Hebrew University. Imagine that.

@jewlicious @bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig I wonder how many of Abu Ahmed's relatives have nowhere to return to because they were ethnically cleansed from their homes by the Israeli settler colonial project.

@bigkittenqueen @HenMazzig Cool! I eat at a restaurant in the Muslim Quarter of the Old City of Jerusalem. Run by Abu Ahmed. There they call it "Salad." They also have divine hummus. It is on the Via Dolorosa between thee 6th and 7th station of the cross. You should go there if you ever visit Jerusalem.
@jewlicious @HenMazzig I eat at a restaurant that calls it Palestinian Salad

"Israeli salad" in Israel is just "Salad." Or "Vegetable Salad." Or just "Vegetables." @HenMazzig knocks it out of the park with his take on our alleged "cultural appropriation" of Arab dishes from countries we lived in before they were colonized by Arabs. https://t.co/Y7DwpQGxys https://t.co/jvg10BBu4Y
